item.title: Cable is the New Fiber?
item.description:
By: John Shepler Coaxial cable, commonly used by cable providers, was once thought to be outdated. People questioned its capacity for handling numerous channels and high internet speeds. However, it turns out coaxial cable can handle significantly more data than initially believed, reaching speeds up to 10 Gbps. Fiber Optic Integration The remarkable 10 Gbps speed, comparable to fiber optic standards, is achieved through a hybrid system. While users only see the coaxial cable connecting their modem, it’s just a small segment of the infrastructure...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/cable-is-the-new-fiber/
